text:
80yo female s/p unwitnessed fall onto concrete on [**4-8**], she does not
   recall how it happened but managed to crawl back into the house and was
   found by her son later in respiratory distress.  Pt brought to [**Hospital1 5**]
   [**Location (un) 3**] and then transferred to [**Hospital1 5**] for further care.  Injuries
   include: large PTX with subcutaneous air-anterior chest tube placed,
   right rib fractures #[**6-2**].
   Pt arrived to TSICU around 10:30 [**4-9**], experiencing significant pain in
   right chest/ribs and respiratory distress.  She required multiple
   nebulizer treatments and had poor sats on nonrebreather (see
   metavision/chart for details).  Pt receiving morphine IVP for pain.
   Despite advanced directive DNR/DNI and known HCP in place, code status
   was discussed with pt by HO at the bedside upon admission to the
   TSICU.  At that time, pt expressed that she would choose to be
   intubated should she need it.  Logroll precautions discontinued per
   Neurosurgery team d/t CT scans showed old spinal fx (per family these
   fx are from 40+ years ago), MRI not obtained of spine as the order was
   discontinued, new spinal injury not suspected.
   [**4-9**]: R posterior CT placed to help diminish air leak and SC emphysema
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 76**])
   Assessment:
   90-97% on 100%FiO2, RR 8-20.  LS rhoncorus BL w/ exp. wheeze noted in
   RLL and LLL. Non-productive weak cough. IS to 500. Desat to 70% and
   cyanotic with turn.  Posterior dry CT placed by team at bedside.
   Draining small amounts serosang.  SC emphysema evident on face, neck, L
   upper arm, entire R arm, BL shoulders, sternum, R anterior and
   posterior chest.  Tmax 99.5.
   Action:
          Albuterol, ipatropium nebs [**Doctor Last Name **]
          HOB to 45, positioned with LLL dependent to improve
   saturations
          Chest xray to verify placement.
          IS 10xhr
          TCDB q1h, chest PT
          Tylenol [**Name (NI) **]
   Response:
          Oxygenation improved after 2minutes in high fowlers with
   100% Fio2.
          SC emphysema slightly improved following second Chest tube
   placement.  Wet and Dry systems positive for leak and crepitus
   Plan:
          Continue to assess for signs of respiratory compromise
          Continue to assess Chest Tubes for leak, and worsening SC
   emphysema.
          Continue aggressive pulmonary toilet
          As result of family meeting yesterday, can intubate for
   Respiratory distress
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Fractured [**6-2**] ribs on Right side secondary to fall.  [**10-2**] pain with
   turning and on deep inspiration.  High risk for pneumonia.
   Action:
          toradol, lidocain patchy, po Tylenol [**Month/Year (2) **]
          Avoid lying on R side r/t pain
          4mg IV morphine given w/ chest tube placment
   Response:
          [**6-1**] pain at rest.
          lethargic and unable to maintain eye contact  or
   conversation after morphine, mentation improved after 2hours.
   Plan:
          Continue to medicate so that able to participate in
   pulmonary hygiene and turning and to rest comfortably.
